 **320 KBPS CBR
 **Cover Art
 -------------------------------------------
 The Runaways were an American all-female rock band that recorded and performed in the second half of the 1970s. The band released four studio albums and one live set during its run. Among their best-known songs are "Cherry Bomb", "Hollywood", "Queens of Noise" and a cover version of the Velvet UndergroundÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s "Rock & Roll". The Runaways, though never a major success in the United States, became a sensation overseas, e.g. in Japan, thanks to the hit single "Cherry Bomb".
 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Live in Japan is a 1977 live album from The Runaways. The album was originally released only in Japan, and some other regions including; Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. It was not intended for release in the USA or UK.
 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 Band Members:

 Cherie Currie: lead vocals
 Joan Jett: rhythm guitar, lead vocals
 Lita Ford: lead guitar, backing vocals
 Jackie Fox: bass, backing vocals
 Sandy West: drums, backing vocals, lead vocals on "Wild Thing"
